revised_title: Radiolysis of Aqueous Oxybromine Compounds: Spectra and Reactions of BrO and BrO2
tldr: The authors studied the radiolysis of aqueous solutions containing oxybromine compounds, focusing on the spectra and reactions of bromine oxides (BrO and BrO2). They used pulse radiolysis and kinetic spectroscopy to analyze the reactions and identify the rate constants of various processes. The findings provide insights into the chemistry of bromine oxides in aqueous solutions.
